results.description:
***This meetup is restricted to people who have attended at least one discussion of the Knapsack meetup group in the last six months. (Most of our meetups count.)***

Each session includes time to: connect with each other, silently reflect and write about our anti-racism work, report on how we're doing regarding our anti-racism work, and receive input and feedback.  We usually do the reporting and input/feedback in small groups of 3-4 people.  If you can't stay as late as 3:30, please go ahead and RSVP, just let us know your limitations.

Remember to bring your notebook, if you have one!  (We'll have a few extra for anyone who hasn't come to an accountability/support session before.) Also, feel free to bring any writings or objects you want to share as part of your anti-racism thinking and work.

We generally schedule one accountability/support session each month. If you are unable to attend and want to be part of accountability, we will consider scheduling an additional session for the month, or choosing a time that works for you in the next month.


For more about our thoughts on these sessions, see "Open discussion to consider monthly accountability sessions."  Note: even if you don't claim to be doing anti-racism work, you can come to the session and see what it is about, as well as consider your own role.  The requirement still applies: you must have attended one of our discussion meetups within the last six months.


This is also a place where you can learn about and find an accountabilibuddy. 

Accessibility Information: Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The fourth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.

Note: We welcome intrepid winter bike riders, though there are not many good spots for parking bikes, and bicycles are prohibited in the building.  We apologize for the inconvenience.
results.name: April Accountability and Support Session

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

1:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

1:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

1:20 - Play!!!!!!

3:00 - Conclude the meetup with snacks and socializing


Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white t-shirt and a colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, pinnies, sunscreen, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

By signing up for this Hike you agree to the Mosaic Outdoor Mountain Club release of Liability below.

We will hike the yellow triangle trail, one of the most popular for beginner hikers. The Yellow Triangle is a wide trail throughout with rolling hills and many flats.

Designed as loop we will walk about 4 miles starting from the rangers headquarters. Please wear proper clothing, sturdy footwear, bring water and snacks.

Requirements: Have a desire to be outdoors, be capable of walking 4 miles at a moderate pace.

Note: Everyone will stay together so we will only be as fast as our slowest walker.

• After parking in the Houghtons Pond lot gather along path parallel to street at far end of lot, heading away from the pond.

results.description:
This program is recommended for first time visitors to the Humanist Hub!

When it comes to being an adult, everyone - and no one - is an expert. At least, everyone past the age of...what, exactly? 

Especially in a community of people who value reason and maturity, it is a virtue to self-awarely recognize there is no perfect state of reason or maturity in a ridiculous world like the one we live in. Yet it still seems important to try our best to be grown up. Perhaps the question is: knowing all we know, is it possible for humanists and allies to be serious about adulthood without losing our sense of childlike joy? 

Join Greg Epstein, Humanist Chaplain at Harvard, for a talk and conversation on what it means to be an adult-- at any age-- in the 21st century. With music, food, discussion circles, and more.
results.name: Greg Epstein: On Being an Adult

group.name: The Humanist Hub in Harvard Square

results.description:
Stoppard fans! The Central Square Theater in Cambridge is putting on Arcadia this spring. Primary information re: the play, theater, etc.:

http://www.centralsquaretheater.org/shows/arcadia/

The theater's short description of the play:

"Science. Scandal. Stoppard.

Derbyshire, England, 1809: A brilliant thirteen year-old, Lady Thomasina Coverly, proposes a scientific theory with implications well beyond her own understanding while her tutor, Septimus Hodge, engages in romantic entanglements with the lady of the house, among others. Simultaneously, present day academics Hannah and Bernard investigate the scandals of Sidley Park in the early 19th Century, including a mysterious visit from Lord Byron and an elusive character known as the Sidley Hermit. Praised as "A play of wit, intellect, language, brio and.. emotion.. exhilarating!' by The New York Times, Tom Stoppard's Arcadia is a romantic and funny exploration of the heart, the sciences, and how history is mis-created."


Both the theater & this playwright/play—which I saw once previously, many years ago—are personal favorites, so I'm confident this will be a terrific show.


If you haven't been to this theater before, it's intimate & the tickets tend to be quite affordable (particularly relative to the performances of the two theater groups that perform there).

I selected the 1st Sun. matinee [EDIT: now updated to the Sun. 4/10 Sun. matinee to accommodate our Meetup group's lead organizer, Anna] in the run & am posting this now (in Dec.) b/c I just checked & noticed that tickets go on sale beginning Dec. 31st.


There's certainly no rush to get tickets; however, I note the on-sale date b/c the theater offers discounts for groups of 10 or more, so if we happened to have that level of interest I'd be happy to contact the theater to find out how much the discount would be.

Also, if there are fewer people interested, I often get email from the theater about discounted individual tickets, so I could try to pass that savings along to those who RSVP sometime closer to the date of the play.


Finally, there are many great places to get a drink &/or some food after the play, all w/in a block or two of the theater in Central Square. I'll bring a few suggestions & then we can decide where to go as a group when we meet up after the play.  (And, btw, please see the "How to find us" info I've added near the top of this posting, below the Meetup location.)


—Cheers, Dave M.
results.how_to_find_us: Upon exiting the theater, look to your immediate left for me & the group in the theater's brick courtyard. [Spotting me: I'll wear the glasses in my profile photo (& have a goatee now) & a gray fleece coat with a white button that says, "Button." :)]
results.name: Arcadia

results.description:
A photographer is an acrobat treading the high wire of chance, trying to capture shooting stars.” – Guy Le Querrec 

Discover how to catch the action by choice rather than by chance.   This Sunday in honor of the Boston Marathon coming up in a few weeks, we will focus on catching life in motion. It is going to be 50 degrees out on Sunday so grab your camera and join this fast paced workshop sure to inspire your creativity. 

Action photography is really about seeing and being in the moment. This is an essential skill if you want to take better pictures. This class will help you be in the right place at the right time to get the shot and to use the right camera settings to freeze the action or blur the motion as you wish.  As a result, you will have more creative freedom to get the shot just the way you want it. Go beyond just being lucky, to being ready to catch the action. 

Urban action by former workshop participant. Amy Oppenheimer  Good example of panning so the subject is clear and the background is blurred.

Skate Boarding in Copley Square Mid air shot, nice clean background without other subjects cluttering the scene. Good positioning.

How many times have you seen the perfect shot unfolding right before your eyes, but you just missed it? Or perhaps you caught the moment but it is a big blur? Join us Sunday to discover the secrets of taking dynamic, action shots that are in crisp focus and correctly exposed. Oh and have fun while you learn. We always have a great group and I am sure you will enjoy meeting the other photographers.

Blur by choice to create the effect of motion in the moment.  Composition choice to have the subject nearly out of the frame. Photo by Suzanne

Some topics we will cover:

• How to set your camera shutter priority to freeze the action

• How to pan the subject so the background is blurred but the subject is clear

• How to pre focus so when the moment happens, you are ready

• Using composition to frame the moment 

How we will work: We will meet at the Boston Public Library at Copley Square I will give a brief introduction to this topic. We will play with the camera settings for the first assignment and then go in search of action.

For the second assignment, we will head down to the Charles River where we can catch a different sort of action with people riding bikes, running, boating etc. The light that time of day should be beautiful and we will be ready to seize the moment. There will be a third, surprise assignment also designed to build your skill on the spot. More about that during the workshop....

First image, incorrect shutter speed. Second image in focus and properly exposed. 

Then after class we will have our usual social time where we will have refreshments and take a look at the photos you all took during the class. After class you will be invited to post some of your best photos of the day on our meetup site for constructive critique. More details about this once you RSVP. 

Low light, dusk action photo on the Charles River. Clear background, blur subject for a more mysterious moody feel.

Tuition for the workshop is $45.00. You are sure to learn how to take better pictures, and meet like minded people when you join us on Sunday. I look forward to seeing you there! This is a non technical group so I will keep the camera settings lingo simple and help you figure it out. All levels welcome to attend this shoot. You have joined the group, now join the fun! 

Suzanne Merritt  

Action photos can also include many subjects other than people. We will discuss other options together.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be on the steps of the Library on the Dartmouth Street Entrance
results.name: Fun Photography Topic: Catching Urban Action In the Moment

True to the ambitious vision of its founder and her spirit of creative risk-taking, the mission of the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum is:

to bring to life and preserve the rich historic collection;

to cultivate talent in the pursuit of knowledge and acts of creation in the arts and humanities;

results.description:
Join us for a hike followed by lunch in Historic Concord

MINUTE MAN NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK is located 22 miles outside of Boston within the towns of Lexington, Lincoln and Concord. The park commemorates the opening battles of the American Revolution on April 19, 1775 by protecting, preserving and interpreting the significant historic sites, structures, landscapes, events and ideas embodied by these events.

We will walk the Battle Road Trail walk. Meet in the visitor center parking lot then walk along the historic trail. This five mile trail connects historic sites from Meriam's Corner in Concord to the eastern boundary of the park in Lexington. The main theme of the trail is the Battle of April 19, 1775, that launched the American Revolution. Much of the trail follows original remnants of the Battle Road; other sections leave the historic road to follow the route of the Minute Men, traversing farming fields, wetlands, and forests.

On April 19, 1775, British soldiers and American militia, "minute men" met in a series of skirmishes along a 22 mile stretch of road that ran from Boston to Concord. The American Revolution began at Lexington and Concord with a clash of arms known to history as "the shot heard round the world."

Dinner and Drinks:

After the hike

The Restaurant after the walk will be "The Great Wall" 309 Great Rd, Bedford, MA 01730


Timeline:

2:15 pm: Official Start time of hike. Please check the comment section for updates on where to find us (especially if you are a little late)

Please arrive at least 15 minutes before hand because we want to get started on time. This is a great time to get to know everyone.

• RSVP RESPONSIBLY! There are a few people in the habit of no-showing and it hurts these events! Don't be that person! Only RSVP if you can go and update your RSVP (don't wait until the day of the event) if you can't make it. Your fellow group members and organizers are counting on you to show up. :) We will be tracking RSVP's:)

• Please dress appropriately for the weather conditions.
Dressing in layers works best. Wear appropriate footwear for hiking.

• Please bring water, snacks and any personal medicines and gear you may need as well. These outings are free but you are responsible to have everything you need.

GETTING THERE From I-95: Take exit 30B to Route 2A west. Continue west on 2A for a half mile. http://www.nps.gov/mima/planyourvisit/upload/MIMA%20Park%20Map.pdf

Take the right at the first national park sign into the access to a paved parking loop.
results.name: Minute Man National Park (Lincoln) Hike & lunch

results.description: This event is to celebrate and honor the essence of the quintessential fruit of the sun and earth, the olive.  We'll start out with introductions so attendees can talk about their own interests, desires and experiences with olive oil. I'll talk about olive oil generally and relate my own experiences as an educated consumer, how I got started with this love affair with it, and why I'm so crazy about this fragrant green-gold ambrosia. Then we'll do a tasting and notice the various qualities that arise: fruity, peppery, spicy, bitter, grassy, bold or delicate. We’ll discuss what we experienced from a sensory and possibly even spiritual perspective. We might have time to talk a bit about the best ways to use olive oil in our cooking.  We’ll conclude with a potluck dinner (with plenty of olive oil, of course) and good conversation.
results.name: Olive oil tasting, discussion and potluck

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Potbelly Sandwich Shop behind CVS (on Somerville Ave) 

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. You can easily spot Potbelly Sandwich Shop on side entrance when you arrive at top of escalator at Porter Square Station. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean

venue.name: The Vilna Shul, Boston's Center for Jewish Culture

results.description:
Co-presented by US Holocaust Museum and Vilna Shul.

In August 1936, the world turned its attention to Nazi Germany for the Summer Olympics. The regime exploited the games to dazzle spectators with an image of a peaceful, tolerant Germany.

Against the backdrop of “Jim Crow” America, the story of the Nazi Olympics becomes much more complex. Black and Jewish athletes, who were facing discrimination at home, were sent to Berlin as competitors, representing the very nation that oppressed them.

Join us for a discussion exploring the stories and varied actions of individual athletes—from those who boycotted the games to those who, like Jesse Owens, competed and won, refuting the Nazi myth of “Aryan” supremacy.

FEATURED SPEAKER
Susan Bachrach, Special Exhibitions Curator
United States Holocaust Memorial Museum

This program is free and open to the public, but registration is required at ushmm.org/events/olympics.
results.name: The Irony of Victory: African American and Jewish Athletes at the Nazi Olympics

group.name: Awesome Jewish Cultural Events in Boston - Open to all!

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

</a>

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour that includes an ice breaker and prizes, light appetizers, and is topped off with four-minute "mini-dates" with the opposite sex.

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  An icebreaker will be provided to held facilitate mingling. Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your dating card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.

We will collect everyone's dating cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

<a href="http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com">http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>

results.description:
Crystal Bowl Meditation Session in a Himalayan Salt Cave.

Also known as ‘singing bowls’, the crystal bowls create an amazing vibration sound, especially when combining different sized bowls.  The bowls originate from the Himalayas and are associated with Tibetan monks. The sound they produce is great for meditation and relaxation.  If you have not experienced a crystal bowling healing, it is an amazing experience!

Join us for Sound Bowl Meditation on Sunday  from 5-6:15 pm. Breathe in the deeply therapeutic air of the salt cave while being bathed in exquisite sound and tone. 

THIS EVENT WILL SELL OUT RSVP NOW TO INSURE YOUR SPOT IN THE CAVE!

THIS MEETUP GROUP WILL HAVE FIRST DIBS, AS OF THURSDAY I WILL OPEN ANY EMPTY SPOTS UP TO OTHER GROUPS. 

PLEASE ONLY RSVP WHEN YOU HAVE MADE YOUR PAYMENT, THANK YOU

COST IS $31.50 to include paypal fees   PLEASE SEND PAYMENT TO MY PAYPAL ACCOUNT:

[masked]

only other option is if you are local you can drop off a check.

When you pay via paypal please drop me a note that you have paid and please include your phone number in case we need to reach you that day!

Appointments are necessary, to join us you must rsvp with payment to hold your spot. This date is held for us only, a private group, if we don't sell out I will open it up to other meetup groups.

_____________________________________________________________________

Welcome to New Hampshire’s first Salt Cave!Bien Soigné is the first to offer this sought-after European healing treatment to New Hampshire.Breathe In…Breathe Out…Renew!

Reduce stress, improve respiratory, skin, and joint ailments.

Our Salt Cave is lined with 18 tons of Himalayan pink salt which was mined and custom cut for our room.  Come experience this all-natural, mineral-based therapy option.

DURING THIS EVENT THE ONLY MACHINE THAT WILL BE RUNNING IS THE HEAT.  YOU WILL STILL BE SURROUNDED BY THE SALT AND WILL GET SIMILAR BENEFITS (PER THE SALON:)

This practice runs approx 75 min long. 

We will carpool to event and will set up carpools week of the event.

Thanks,

Sue

ABOUT SALT CAVES AND BIEN SOIGNE:


Bien Soigné is the first Day Spa in New Hampshire to offer this unique therapeutic treatment. Sometimes called halotherapy chambers, the Salt Cave is designed to provide a relaxing experience with multiple healing benefits.


Salt Cave therapy is a risk-free, non-invasive, natural treatment with no known side effects. The anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial properties of this treatment can provide relief for a variety of health conditions including:

Relief from respiratory ailments including allergies, sinus infections, colds, Asthma, Bronchitis, and COPDHelp improve skin conditions such as acne, psoriasis, and eczemaCystic-fibrosis patients are experiencing “less shortness of breath, less coughing and decreased sinus pressure.”

(New England Journal of Medicine)Reduce stress and improve sleep patterns Help with joint pain and stiffness

Our cave has 18 tons of pink Himalayan salt – mined, custom cut, and shipped to New Hampshire.  We have tiled the walls of our cave with this special salt, and have also added a halogenerator which heats, crushes, and disperses micro-particles of the salt into the cave. The concentrations of salt particles can be adjusted for varying respiratory issues. Bacteria or viruses cannot live in this high concentration of pure Himalayan salt and therefore cannot be spread through the air to other guests in the cave.

Note: If you have any questions or concerns regarding your medical conditions and halo-therapy, we recommend that you consult with your physician before booking an appointment in the Salt Cave. 

Designed for Total Relaxation!

Enter through the massive wooden doors inspired by Himalayan meditation rooms, and unwind in a free-floating, zero-gravity lounge chair. Suspended in time for the next 45 minutes, surrounded by the beauty of our pink Himalayan salt, you will emerge restored, relaxed, and rejuvenated!

Breathe in – and feel the micro-particle salt begin to work it’s magic.  If you came in feeling a bit under the weather, you will walk out feeling renewed!

Our Salt Cave experience is designed for convenience.  There’s no need to change your clothing. You can simply stop in and head straight for the Salt Cave!


Any other questions or concerns can be found on their website:


http://biensoigne.com/salt-cave/

results.description:
Sun 04/10/2016, 5:00 pm - 6:15 pm


The energy of the human mind is thought, one of the greatest but least understood energy resources of the universe. Yet how many of us have really explored our minds? A Positive Thinking workshop will improve your understanding of your mind and provide tools and practices that help you create thoughts in a positive and healing way. Much more than simply “you are what you think”, these positive thinking techniques help you improve your outlook and get the very best out of your life!
results.name: POSITIVE THINKING

results.description:
Every Sunday night the Elks has bingo upstairs in their function room. Doors open at 4:30, the first card is called at 6:30. I will have space reserved for us but will need to give up the reserved seating by 5:45 so please be there by 5:30.

They have multiple games - regular bingo, layer cake, postage stamps. They have a sheet that will list the games in order and a "cheat sheet" with a picture of what the specialty games are. The "cards" are sheets of paper. You can choose how many cards you play - 9, 15, etc. I recommend if this is the first time you are playing bingo buy less than more. They will not slow down the calling for one or two people but there is a lighted board and a TV screen that shows the numbers called. They serve food and non alcoholic beverages. You will need a bingo dabber. They sell them there if you don't have one. 

There are a lot of regulars who take the same seats every week. Therefore I do not know where our seats will be just check in with me when you get there. There is a chance that I may be volunteering at the bingo that night - so I may not be seated at a table.
results.how_to_find_us: Upstairs in the function room
results.name: B-I-N-G-O

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter at The Hawthorne Building, the large glass doors to the left of H&R Block.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

5:15 – 5:45 DINNER & FELLOWSHIP

Bible reading (Grammar & vocabulary),
Learning about the Christianity Basics

results.name: Harvard SQ: Sunday Meet-up with free Dinner

results.description:
Please pay as you go. Cash please if you can. Wait staff are fabulous & patient but please help them this way and don't make them hate us... tip generously. Reserved tables: perambulate past reception to the reserved tags on the tables there.

Woody Allen on Pessimism,
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6pAObJ_rIU4  
  
There is Red Line shuttle bus "service" (or should I say lack thereof) today between Alewife and Harvard Sq stations. Yuck...  SO GIVE YOURSELVES AN EXTRA 20 MINUTES IF YOU ARE "Ting" IT FROM ALEWIFE.
  Do Optimists survive longer or Pessimists?

"A Pessimist is an informed Optimist"... lets go with this premise.

Optimism... "The doctrine, or belief, that everything is beautiful, including what is ugly... especially the bad, and everything right is wrong. It is held with tenacity by those most accustomed to the mischance of falling into adversity, and is most acceptably expounded with the grin that apes a smile. Being a blind faith, it is inaccessible to the light of disproof-- an intellectual disorder.. it is.. fortunately not contagious" --Ambrose Bierce (The Devil's Dictionary)

Join us yet again for this now legendary Nerd Fun endeavor, in the heart of intellectual snobbery, Harvard Sq. Be there or be Sq.

You don't have to be a genuine Intellectual snob to join. Pseudo-intellectuals are also welcome. All you need is an aloof attitude full of irony and some baffling intellectual ideas or--dare I say it-- some question you have always wanted the answer to and now have the opportunity to get incognito.

Humor in good taste: ALLOWED. Intellectual apparel: allowed. Startle the waitstaff with a fake mustache, goatee, periwig, or monocle. Or startling question such as "what is life?" (But don't startle them when they are carrying trays around with cocktail glasses, because if they get dropped, they may want to kill you.)

Woody Allen on pessimism
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6pAObJ_rIU4

Fold-up sunglasses, corduroy jackets w/ elbow patches: allowed. No Meerschaum tabacco pipes please. Absinthe is not served.

Please bring cash and "pay as you go".
results.how_to_find_us: Reserved area at the "tall" tables just behind reception, look for "reserved" signs.
results.name: Intellectual Snob Meetup-- Pessimism, Optimism, & Woody Allen

venue.address_1: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138
venue.name: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138

results.description:
Join the oldest established permanent floating Community Walk in Cambridge and Environs.  Join the Community Walkers and walkers from five other meetup groups.   Let's join 20+ others from six other walking groups for:

Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 4/10 6:00

results.description:
Join The Oldest Established Permanent Floating Community Walk in Cambridge 

For the 200th consecutive Sunday, we will be walking.   Let's join 20 or so others from other walking groups for this walk.

The walk is on, rain or shine.


Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.


Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

We'll all go out for dinner afterwards, somewhere in the neighborhood.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 4/10 6:00

results.description:
Join the Fresh Pond Walking Community for our regular Sunday walk around Fresh Pond.   

Let's join regular walkers from surrounding towns + members of five other walking groups and 20+ walkers for this walk.  Walk is on, Rain or Shine.

Few things are more enjoyable than a nice walk and a chat at the end of a busy weekend.

Since May 2012, we've met with a few other meetup groups Let's join for a stroll in a beautiful setting.

We walk clockwise, so if you get there late, just start walking counter-clockwise and you'll run into us.

Parking on Huron Avenue is easy, since the "Permit Parking" rules don't apply on Sunday - just park in any spot on Huron Ave, there will be plenty of them.

If you're coming by bus, take the 71 or 73 bus from Harvard Square and get off at Aberdeen Ave. Walk all the way up Aberdeen until you come to Huron Avenue, we'll be there.

Afterwards, we'll go out for dinner. We usually go for some unusual Chinese food, and the total cost is about $10 per person.

If you have trouble finding us, call me at[masked]

results.description:
All Outdoor Meetup Members get 20℅ off gear and clothing.   All EMS stores.  Here's the details:

"We are having a private sale for outdoor clubs and meetups on April 10th from 6-9pm at the Harvard Square Eastern Mountain Sports and your group is invited! Attendees will get 20% off their whole purchase, regardless of full price, sale, or clearance items. All EMS stores will be having an event this day so your members are welcome to attend any other store's event if it's more convenient for them - there's a store in Newton and one in Boston. The Newton store has boating equipment if that's important to someone! [At the Harvard Square location] we're specifically trying to cater to the rock climbing community, as we have the best climbing gear selection out of all the local stores."

FYI, if interested in checking out the event at a different store other than Harvard Square, best to call the store ahead of time to confirm their sale hours.
results.name: Eastern Mountain Sports Private 20% OFF Sale

results.description:
Spring is HERE !!! Are you Ready to Enjoy the cycling season?

Here is another awesome opportunity for our members to SAVE while we all GEAR up for spring.

Check out the EMS Private Sale event at the Harvard Square EMS Store on April 10th from 6PM to 9 PM. Store will be closed to regular customers. It is a private sale.

EMS is offering a 20% storewide discount. Attendees will get 20% off their whole purchase, regardless of full price, sale, or clearance items.  Also, EMS Rewards members will earn Double Points on their entire transaction.

All EMS stores will be having an event this day so your members are welcome to attend any other store's event if it's more convenient for them - there's a store in Newton and one in Boston. The Newton store has boating equipment if that's important to someone! 


All you have to do is bring a copy of this email or posting. With Club Day, EMS is celebrating those who are out there enjoying outdoor activities, providing outdoor recreational opportunities, and protecting our precious outdoor resources.


EMS would like to thank our group for being a valued member of the EMS family. I hope to see you on April 10th from 6PM to 9 PM.

Please RSVP so we know how many to expect and can help EMS plan logistics.
results.name: EMS Private Sale!! 20% OFF STOREWIDE EXCLUSIVELY to our members !!

results.name: EMS Private Sale

results.description:
A few years ago we entered into a sponsorship arrangement with Eastern Mountain Sports and it's time for our Sales Event. As you know, they are headquartered right here in New England and carry much of the apparel, footwear and gear that we all use during our daily adventures!

Don’t miss the EMS First Tracks Sale for members of the Random Group of Hikers and a couple of other Meetup Groups in the area. The sale is Sunday, April 10th from 6:00 pm - 9:00 pm in their Newton Store, which is located at 300 Needham Street in Newton MA. 

During the sale, we will all be treated to an exclusive, special offer of 20% off storewide (there will be limited restrictions). EMS will have representatives on site doing clinics and hosting raffles and store guides will help you with personalized shopping. This will be an incredible way to gear up for the spring and summer season!

If you are looking for ideas of what you might need you can visit the various gear lists that we have posted on the group's page:

• http://www.meetup.com/random-hikers/files/

Please RSVP so we know how many to expect and can help EMS plan logistics. You are welcome to bring friends and family to this event. There will be great deals and additional discounts for all invitees.

To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
How would you like to suddenly have the ability to easily make friends and get dates wherever you go?  Listen, if you've ever had a deep desire to have a great social life, but felt like it was really hard because you're not the typical "cool" person, then you're going to love this!

Here's what this is all about:  My name is Jason, and I've created a special workshop that will teach you how to have a rich social life full of friends and people who would love to be in a relationship with you.

Imagine going to a social gathering and being greeted by your group of warm, wonderful friends who really care about you.  Imagine being able to effortlessly attract someone special into your life who truly loves you for who you are on the inside.

All of this is possible, and I should know more than anyone.  I used to be so shy and socially awkward that I avoided all parties and never even stepped foot into a bar until my 30's.  I wasn't fashionable, and I wasn't classically good-looking.  And I would only get to date whoever happened to show interest in me.  I never had any real choice when it came to love.

But then I discovered a handful of simple secrets that changed everything.  Even though I looked and sounded the same, my social life began taking off! Before I knew it, I was going out several nights per week and being invited to lots of parties.  I started getting dates like crazy with almost no work on my part. It was just happening effortlessly and automatically, and it's all because of the few simple secrets I'll share with you at this event.

*************************************************
HERE'S A SMALL SAMPLE OF WHAT YOU'LL LEARN:
*************************************************  

* Where to meet high-quality people for friendship and dating.  If you've ever found yourself asking, "Where are all the good men/women?" then this first section is for you.  And the best part?  These are places where people are already open to meeting you!

* A magical technique I recently discovered that instantly makes people feel more connected to you and makes them want to get to know you better.  This is the first time I'm teaching this publicly.  You can use this for dating, friendship, and even business, and people will find themselves making excuses to spend more time with you.

* The single most important ability you must develop if you want people to bond with you.  I'll reveal what it is, and then give you a conversational technique that works instantly to create that connection.

* The absolute easiest way to approach people and start conversations at Meetups or other social gatherings.  It works even if you're painfully shy, and the good news is that this simple technique for starting conversations is basically rejection-proof.  Itworks 99 times out of a 100, and those are pretty good odds.

* The #1 secret to having a life other people want to be a part of.  You can get all the other things right, but if you miss this one thing, you'll never have the results you truly want both in your social life and your love life.

* And much more!

*************************************************
WANT TO JOIN US?  HERE'S HOW:
*************************************************

Where is it? The seminar is conveniently located at the Watertown Center For Healing Arts which is a beautiful facility for an event like this.

What time? Please plan on arriving by 6:45pm so you have time to settle in and meet the other members. We start promptly at 7:00pm and go until 9:30pm (with a break in the middle).  There are plenty of bus lines that go to the center, and there is also lots of parking both on the street and in a big parking lot near the center.  The bottom of this page has details:

http://watertowncenter.net/directions-2/

How much? Cheap.  If you took a class like this through an adult education center, you'd easily pay more than $50 to attend, and that's assuming there evenisa class that could offer you all this, which there isn't.

No other class offers you this kind of cutting edge training that's based in real world results.  This stuff WORKS!  What if one small change is all it takes to immediately and effortlessly begin attracting high-quality friends and dating prospects into your life?  I've seen it happen many times in this group, and it can happen for you too. 

So how much? Because I want to help as many people as I can, I've decided to keep the price very affordable so that anyone who wants to come will be able to.  The cost for this event is only $20, which is very low considering the quality of training that you'll be getting.

Think about it...that's 67 cents a day for a month.  What else do you spend 67 cents on every day that makes no difference in your social life (or love life) whatsoever? I promise that this will be well worth your time.

How big is the class? In order to make sure I can personally help as many people as possible, the class is limited to the first 50 people who RSVP.  This is not a lecture.  We are going to be moving around and doing lots of fun exercises, so I have to limit the size.  I'm listing this event in 2 different meetup groups, so there are literally more than 12,500 people seeing this listing.  

Go ahead and put in your RSVP right now in order to secure your spot.  I'm looking forward to seeing you there.

Warmly, 
Jason

P.S. - Take down my cell number in case you have any questions about the event or if you get lost. The venue is extremely easy to find, so you should have no problems, but just in case, my cell is[masked]-8871.
results.how_to_find_us: Go through the front door, up the stairs, and follow the signs that say SEMINAR.  It's easy to find.

results.description:
This workshop will increase your confidence with body movement while dancing Salsa. Kristina learned Cuban dances (salsa, son, casino, rumba) in her home country Sweden, where she trained with several different Cuban instructors and choreographers from Havana.
When she moved to Boston, she teamed up with leader of DC Casineros Amanda Gill, to assist in her classes and perform with her ladies team Cubania. During the years in Boston, Kristina has taught classes and workshops in Cuban dances with MIT casino rueda, Boston rueda, Masacote dance company, Metamovements, RI Latin Dance and independently. She specializes in teaching Cuban partner dances with focus on technique and body movement.

(Grand Ballroom) Workshop Hours: 7pm-8pm

$10- Workshop
S10- Social Dancing
$20- Workshop and Social Dancing

**Contact me at (203)[masked] if you have any questions regarding the workshop.
results.name: Cuban SALSA Body Movement w/ Kristina Masson

results.description:
The Shambhala Boston LGBT Meditation Group offers a safe space for those who identify as queer, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, or questioning to come together to explore the practice of meditation and support each other in community.  Previous meditation experience is not required.


This April's gathering will include sitting plus a talk and discussion led by Charlie Byron. Charlie is a long time practitioner and senior teacher in the Shambhala tradition who has led LGBTQ retreats and other programs in the past.. His talk is sure to bring humor and authenticity combined with a solid grounding in the dharma. 

Charlie sent us a preview of his talk which is below. :-)


"Sometimes we have the habit of focusing on our problems.  But our own history, as an LGBTQ person reading this announcement, includes bravery and brilliance — or how could we have gotten this far?  We can take that as a working basis, and look for how to grow in that direction.  Doing that means treating ourselves as good already - not needing fixing.  To make a habit of that, we need to practice it.  Like anything, our norm is to just keep reinforcing our old habit.  Sitting meditation is the most profound gentleness we can extend toward ourselves.  Join us on Sunday April 10, to touch in to our best parts and to practice kindness toward our whole selves."  

Hope to see you there!
results.name: LGBT Meditation Group

How big is the class? In order to make sure I can personally help as many people as possible, the class is limited to the first 50 people who RSVP.  This is not a lecture.  We are going to be moving around and doing lots of fun exercises, so I have to limit the size.  I'm listing this event in 2 different meetup groups, so there are literally more than 12,500 people seeing this listing.  

Go ahead and put in your RSVP right now in order to secure your spot.  I'm looking forward to seeing you there.

Warmly,  
Jason

P.S. - Take down my cell number in case you have any questions about the event or if you get lost. The venue is extremely easy to find, so you should have no problems, but just in case, my cell is[masked]-8871.

results.description:
How would you like to suddenly have the ability to easily make friends and get dates wherever you go?  Listen, if you've ever had a deep desire to have a great social life, but felt like it was really hard because you're not the typical "cool" person, then you're going to love this!

Here's what this is all about:  My name is Jason, and I've created a special workshop that will teach you how to have a rich social life full of friends and people who would love to be in a relationship with you.

Imagine going to a social gathering and being greeted by your group of warm, wonderful friends who really care about you.  Imagine being able to effortlessly attract someone special into your life who truly loves you for who you are on the inside.

All of this is possible, and I should know more than anyone.  I used to be so shy and socially awkward that I avoided all parties and never even stepped foot into a bar until my 30's.  I wasn't fashionable, and I wasn't classically good-looking.  And I would only get to date whoever happened to show interest in me.  I never had any real choice when it came to love.

But then I discovered a handful of simple secrets that changed everything.  Even though I looked and sounded the same, my social life began taking off! Before I knew it, I was going out several nights per week and being invited to lots of parties.  I started getting dates like crazy with almost no work on my part. It was just happening effortlessly and automatically, and it's all because of the few simple secrets I'll share with you at this event.

************************************************* 
HERE'S A SMALL SAMPLE OF WHAT YOU'LL LEARN: 
*************************************************  

* Where to meet high-quality people for friendship and dating.  If you've ever found yourself asking, "Where are all the good men/women?" then this first section is for you.  And the best part?  These are places where people are already open to meeting you!

* A magical technique I recently discovered that instantly makes people feel more connected to you and makes them want to get to know you better.  This is the first time I'm teaching this publicly.  You can use this for dating, friendship, and even business, and people will find themselves making excuses to spend more time with you.

* The single most important ability you must develop if you want people to bond with you. I'll reveal what it is, and then give you a conversational technique that works instantly to create that connection.

* The absolute easiest way to approach people and start conversations at Meetups or other social gatherings.  It works even if you're painfully shy, and the good news is that this simple technique for starting conversations is basically rejection-proof.  Itworks 99 times out of a 100, and those are pretty good odds.

* The #1 secret to having a life other people want to be a part of.  You can get all the other things right, but if you miss this one thing, you'll never have the results you truly want both in your social life and your love life.

* And much more!

************************************************* 
WANT TO JOIN US?  HERE'S HOW: 
*************************************************

Where is it? The seminar is conveniently located at the Watertown Center For Healing Arts which is a beautiful facility for an event like this.

What time? Please plan on arriving by 6:45pm so you have time to settle in and meet the other members. We start promptly at 7:00pm and go until 9:30pm (with a break in the middle).  There are plenty of bus lines that go to the center, and there is also lots of parking both on the street and in a big parking lot near the center.  The bottom of this page has details:

http://watertowncenter.net/directions-2/

How much? Cheap.  If you took a class like this through an adult education center, you'd easily pay more than $50 to attend, and that's assuming there evenisa class that could offer you all this, which there isn't.

No other class offers you this kind of cutting edge training that's based in real world results.  This stuff WORKS!  What if one small change is all it takes to immediately and effortlessly begin attracting high-quality friends and dating prospects into your life?  I've seen it happen many times in this group, and it can happen for you too. 

So how much? Because I want to help as many people as I can, I've decided to keep the price very affordable so that anyone who wants to come will be able to.  The cost for this event is only $20, which is very low considering the quality of training that you'll be getting.

Think about it...that's 67 cents a day for a month.  What else do you spend 67 cents on every day that makes no difference in your social life (or love life) whatsoever? I promise that this will be well worth your time.

How big is the class? In order to make sure I can personally help as many people as possible, the class is limited to the first 50 people who RSVP.  This is not a lecture.  We are going to be moving around and doing lots of fun exercises, so I have to limit the size.  I'm listing this event in 2 different meetup groups, so there are literally more than 12,500 people seeing this listing.  

Go ahead and put in your RSVP right now in order to secure your spot.  I'm looking forward to seeing you there.

Warmly, 
Jason

P.S. - Take down my cell number in case you have any questions about the event or if you get lost. The venue is extremely easy to find, so you should have no problems, but just in case, my cell is[masked]-8871.

results.description:
This User's Guide orientation is intended to help active members who have attended at least three PGN events and are looking to utilize PGN more powerfully for their lives; it is also quite useful for members who might want to investigate being a leader and/or organizing events on PGN.

Topics

- (Back story: The genesis of PGN)
- Developing the qualities necessary for personal growth
- How PGN benefits active members
- How you can participate more fully
- Advanced user navigation
- Becoming an active member

About the Personal Growth Network

The Personal Growth Network is a first-of-its-kind meta-organizer, bringing together diverse personal growth and positive psychology tools and techniques that are designed to help generally healthy people create greater joy and more success in all parts of their life.  Members can try out, learn, and practice numerous approaches; they can select some approaches for more in-depth study and application to their lives; they can practice, support, and share a particular approach with other members; and they can return to PGN to explore different approaches or to work on other parts of their life.  

PGN is also a community of like-hearted people who share an important, but not widely distributed, combination of values and characteristics (e.g., curiosity, willingness to learn, willingness to change habits) around consciously and proactively crafting a life well-lived.  For people with this important combination of characteristics, engaging with other members of the community can be fascinating, supportive, and affirming.

And finally, PGN is a toolbox with which members can create successful events.  Members can create workshops, practice groups, and social events through which they can share their journey, their gifts, their joy, their successes, their vision, and their interests.

About the Orientation Series

Given the enormous ambition and power of the Personal Growth Network, and its rapid growth, it is easy to feel a little overwhelmed at first, so we offer some "How-To" guides to maximize your utilization of the Personal Growth Network for whatever your goals may be.  


Our Orientations include:

For Participants 


- Wed May 4: Newbie Introduction 
. . . (For new, infrequent, or curious members) 
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Thu Jun 16)

- Tues May 31: User's Guide 
. . . (For active members of PGN) 
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Thu Jul 28)

- Thu Jun 30: Customize PGN 
. . . (For reducing emails and focusing on your growth areas)
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Wed Sep 7)


For Leaders 

- Sun Apr 24: Intro to PGN Leadership 
. . . (For members considering offering events) 
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Mon Aug 1)

- Sun May 8: Create an Event on PGN 
. . . (For members ready to offer an event) 
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Thu Sept 1)

- Sun May 15: Build Your Brand 
. . . (For leaders who want to build an identity.)
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Thu Sept 29)

About This Particular Orientation:

There is no prerequisite to take this Orientation, although it may be useful to have taken the Newbie Orientation.  It is conceived for those members who are, or would like to be, active members on PGN.  Some of the concepts introduced here are expected to be understood in the leadership orientations.

I will also try to address any specific questions that you post below. 

About The Webinar Technology:

This orientation is offered as a "Zoom Webinar".  This means that you will need a computer, and you will need to be in a location where you can listen and watch without distractions.  (There will be opportunities for video discussion as well, so you may want to look presentable, at least from the waist up. )

The webinar software used is Zoom.  It runs on most platforms.  If you have not run it before, please click on the link a half-hour before, to ensure that it is working on your system.

The link will be sent to you the day before the event.

Testimonials from Past Participants

Excellent and very helpful to me! Looking forward to participating in many more PGN events :)
- Karen322

Very informative. Organized well. Great quality software platform. Precisely what "advertised" as.
- Sarah Rose

FANTASTIC! One of the best meetups I have ever been to (and I've been to 300+ and hosted a solid 1/2 of those)! Great presentation. Nice overview of the meetup group site - awesome tools for using meetup in general, too. Get in on one of these events!!! (Wondering if this should be a requirement w/in 6 months of joining or something?) Looking forward to meeting many fantastic people and growing together!!!
- Angela

Great! Very well organized. Very thoroughly and helpfully informative.
- Katrina

I really enjoyed your orientation.  I didn't expect to learn anything new as I've been attending PGN events for close to a year, but I never knew about the "Pages" on the site.
- Susan James
results.name: PGN_Orientation: User's Guide to PGN

results.description:
The 2016 Charles Eliot Norton Professorship in Poetry has been awarded to Toni Morrison - The Origin of Others - The Literature of Belonging

A series of lectures by Toni Morrison.

These lectures are free, but tickets are required. Get Tix HERE. 

Tickets will be available starting at noon on the day of each lecture. Tickets will be available in person at Sanders Theatre or online HERE (handling fees apply). Limit of two tickets per person. Tickets valid until 3:45pm.

Lecture Five: Narrating the Other - Monday, April 11, 2016, 4pm

Sanders Theatre, 45 Quincy Street

:: :: ::

Lecture One: Romancing Slavery - Wednesday, March 2, 2016

Lecture Two: Being and Becoming the Stranger - Tuesday, March 8, 2016

Lecture Three: The Color Fetish - Wednesday, March 9, 2016

Lecture Four: Configurations of Blackness - Tuesday, March 22, 2016

Lecture Five: Narrating the Other - Monday, April 11, 2016

Lecture Six: The Foreigner's Home - Tuesday, April 12, 2016

:: :: ::

The Charles Eliot Norton Professorship in Poetry was endowed in 1925. Harvard's preeminent lecture series in the arts and humanities, the Norton Lectures recognize individuals of extraordinary talent who, in addition to their particular expertise, have the gift of wide dissemination and wise expression. The term "poetry" is interpreted in the broadest sense to encompass all poetic expression in language, music, or the fine arts. Past Norton Professors have included T.S. Eliot, Jorge Luis Borges, Leonard Bernstein, Czeslaw Milosz, John Cage, and Nadine Gordimer.
results.name: Toni Morrison on "The Other"

results.description:
What is the most important skill a professional consultant needs for a successful practice? According to Scott Loring – mediator, executive coach, and negotiation consultant – it’s the ability to deliver genuine empathy to all parties in a transaction.

Empathy is the ability to show your deep understanding of the needs and motivations behind others’ demands, requests, and actions. By showing you understand, even when you don’t agree, you build rapport and trust with your clients and others.

Scott’s enlightening and interactive session covers:

• The three-step formula for delivering empathy quickly and authentically.

• The way to listen for the underlying interests behind others’ complaints.

• The differences between empathy, sympathy, advice, and assurances.

• The reason empathy is the single most important tool for repairing misunderstandings.

• The way empathy creates opportunities for building trust and referrals.

With the tools you will learn in this session, you will be able to close more deals, create a more positive client experience, and generate more referrals.

The cost is $45 for members and first time attendees. All others are $55. Late registration for members is $55 and $65 for all others. Please remember to go here to register http://spconsultants.org/event-2193796<a href="http://spconsultants.org/event-2113757"></a> or bring a check or cash to the event.
results.name: Using Your Empathy Skills to Close More Deals

results.description:
SING STREET takes us back to 1980s Dublin seen through the eyes of a 14-year-old boy named Conor (Ferdia Walsh-Peelo) who is looking for a break from a home strained by his parents’ relationship and money troubles, while trying to adjust to his new inner-city public school where the kids are rough and the teachers are rougher. He finds a glimmer of hope in the mysterious, über-cool and beautiful Raphina (Lucy Boynton), and with the aim of winning her heart he invites her to star in his band’s music videos. There’s only one problem: he’s not part of a band… yet. She agrees, and now Conor must deliver what he’s promised—calling himself “Cosmo” and immersing himself in the vibrant rock music trends of the decade, he forms a band with a few lads, and the group pours their heart into writing lyrics and shooting videos. Inspired by writer/director John Carney’s (ONCE, BEGIN AGAIN) life and love for music, SING STREET shows us a world where music has the power to take us away from the turmoil of everyday life and transform us into something greater.

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

Akamai is 3 blocks from the MBTA Kendall Station (Red Line). Walk West one block on Main St, then north one block on Ames St, then west less than one block on Broadway. Akamai is in the building on the left just before Galileo Galilei Way.

There are limited meters located on Broadway Street. The SP Plus Technology Square Garage is 1.5 blocks away at 593 Hampshire St (bet. Main St-Broadway) and $25. The SP Plus One Broadway Garage is 2.5 blocks away at 1 Broadway (enter on Third St) and $10. The Pilgrim Parking Garage is at 350 Kendall St and $8.

Upon Arrival:

Akamai staff will be escorting attendees from the lobby up the stairs to the first floor, where you'll find our check-in table. Type the first few letters of your name on the screen and tap your name to print your name tag.

results.description:
"The Evolution of Individual Differences: Personality, Politics, and Sex"
Guest scientist Max Krasnow

Meet us Monday, April 11 at 6:30pm at The Burren in Davis Square (please note the earlier start time)

Max Krasnow is an assistant professor Psychology at Harvard. He the leader of the Evolutionary Psychology Lab, and his research focuses on the mechanisms underlying human social behavior and how they evolved. One line of this research has explored how the fact that the future of any interaction is uncertain conspires with distinctive features of the hominin social niche to select for organisms that are more generous, trusting and cooperative than an otherwise rational analysis would predict. In related work, he has shown in a series of behavioral experiments how these and other fundamental components of human social behavior, like our concern for the treatment of others and our punitive sentiments towards bad actors, can help cultivate mutually beneficial cooperative relationships and improve their terms when they begin to function poorly.

Science by the Pint is a monthly science cafe free and open to the public, run by the Harvard non-profit outreach group Science In The News (SITN). Read more here: http://sitn.hms.harvard.edu/science-by-the-pint/
results.name: Science by the Pint: The Evolution of Individual Differences
