results.description:
Join Ronald Kolek and Amy Major in an enchanting evening of Victorian table tipping. Table tipping is a unique form of physical mediumship that allows participants to communicate with spirits through the use of small, round tipping tables. With the help of the spirits, these tables tip or tilt in order to form a communication of “yes” or “no” answers. The tables can also form a dialog between spirits and participants through tipping out letters of the alphabet. Tipping tables were heavily used in old Victorian spirit séances and events as a way to communicate with dearly departed souls.
Ron and Amy will discuss the history of table tipping, explain the energy of spirit vibrations and how it is used with the table, and provide a full demonstration of table tipping. Participants will then use provided tables to practice table tipping and communicate with spirits on the other-side.
This enchanted evening will be enjoyed with old Victorian style music and ambience.
Victorian dress is optional, but best dressed wins a prize!
The night will end with tea, pastries and conversation.
Unitarian Universalist Church, 6 Locke St, Andover, MA 01810, Friday, April 15th, 7-10pm
Cost for this event is $29 p/p. Please contact Circles of Wisdom for tickets at http://www.circlesofwisdom.com/ or calling[masked]=98010• 90 Main Street, Andover, MA 01810
results.name: An Enchanted Evening of Victorian Table Tipping

group.name: New England Ghost Project's Paranormal Study Group

results.description:
The  BEATLE JUICE BAND!

Melrose Memorial Hall!

Friday April 15th @ 7:00 PM.

You can get your tickets at:

https://beatlejuice.eventbrite.com 

For over 17 years Beatlejuice has been the #1 choice for Beatles fans looking to get their fix of the Fab 4.

Faithfully reproducing some of the greatest songs ever written, Beatlejuice covers every era of the Beatles catalog and on to the solo careers of the boys from Liverpool.

https://youtu.be/7OPkJBgIpaU

http://www.muzzdrums.com/Beatlejuice.html

Melrose Memorial Hall

Doors open at 6 pm, show starts at 7:30 pm. This is an all ages show.

The evening will include cash bar, raffle prizes, pizza and more, paid separately.

You can get your tickets at:

EVENTBRITE TICKET LINK

Hello everyone, I am really looking forward to this event.

I have reserved and paid for 1 table for 10 people. The first 10 to buy tickets using Eventbrite link will be seated at it. All other tickets will have non table seats near NSS table. IF ENOUGH PEOPLE BUY NON TABLE SEATS I WILL TRY TO GET A SECOND TABLE.

I will be waiting for you @ the door till 7:00 pm to check you in. If you are going to be late please call me on my phone to meet you @ door [masked]-9788.

Memorial Hall

Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Building

The Soliders & Sailors Memoiral Building was dedicated on Dec. 14, 1912 in remembrance of the soldiers and sailors of the Civil War. John Slayton donated the building to the city and was chairman of the building committee. 
Memorial Hall hosts events throughout the year and features a seating capacity of 800 in the main auditorium, which has a 30-foot by 40-foot stage, dressing rooms and a public address system. The main auditorium is also home to a grand organ at the rear of the stage, dedicated in 1919 as a memorial to the World War I veterans.

Accessibility Details: Ramp at side entrance; ramps inside to auditorium floor; elevator to second floor and bathrooms on lower level

Memorial Hall offers free parking: In the City Hall parkinglot, located at the rear.

The  BEATLEJUICE BAND!

You can get your tickets at:

EVENTBRITE TICKET LINK

Memorial Hall

Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Building

DRIVING DIRECTIONS

(1) Route 93 North Exit 34 (Melrose/Stoneham - Rt. 28 - Stone Zoo) Right at next set of lights

(2) From 128 & North Route 93 South Exit 35 (Winchester Highlands/Melrose) Right at stop sign Straight through set of lights

Directions now the same for both (1) & (2) Past Stone Zoo (on right) Next left after Zoo - Pond St./W. Wyoming (Small green sign says Melrose) Downhill to set of lights (J.J. Grimbsy Restaurant at intersection) Straight through set of lights Over train tracks to next set of lights (intersection W. Wyoming/Main St.) Left at set of lights onto Main St. Building is on the left just after the Central Fire Station, 590 Main St.

(3) From Route 1 North / South: Essex St. Melrose/Stoneham Exit for both

Note:

For Rt. 1 North exit is after Walgreens

For Rt. 1 South exit is before Burger King

Past Sears (on right),now on Upham St. to set of lights Straight through set of lights (intersection of Upham & Lebanon St.) Right at next set of lights onto Main St. Building is on the left just after the Central Fire Station, 590 Main St.

A MULTIPLE MEETUP EVENT SPONSORED BY:

NORTH SHORE SOCIAL

Please RSVP for this event in only one group and keep your RSVP up to date.

THANK YOU AND BE  SAFE, YOURS TRULY EIRINI KAY.

You can get your tickets at:

EVENTBRITE TICKET LINK

results.description:
Details from the Chevaliertheatre.com website,
Tickets are $35, $45 and $55

As a mandolinist, singer, and composer, David Grisman is a great pioneer of jamgrass. After founding a band in 1973 called Old and in the Way with close friend Jerry Garcia (who gave him the nickname “Dawg”), Grisman created the David Grisman Bluegrass Experience and hit the road for forty years. With influences ranging from hot jazz to classic rock and even old-world Mediterranean folk, Grisman come to the Chevalier Theatre, this time with his hard-hitting sextet. The Sextet includes Jim Kerwin (bass), Matt Eakle (flute and bass flute), George Marsh (drums and percussion), Chad Manning (violin, viola and mandolin) and George Cole (guitar).

COLD CHOCOLATE is creating an exciting and unique new sound in the world of Americana: fusing bluegrass and roots with a dash of funk. With original tunes and technical prowess, this trio from Boston is rocking audiences with guitar, upright bass, percussion, and three-part harmony. Guitarist/songwriter Ethan Robbins began his bluegrass career at Oberlin College where he met upright bassist Kirsten Lamb and began to explore how this hard-driving fast-paced genre could be stretched. Now joined by the loose-wristed Ariel Bernstein on percussion, Cold Chocolate has established itself as a force in the Americana genre.
results.name: David Grisman Sextet and Cold Chocolate at Chevalier Theatre in Medford

results.description:
Meetup at MetroRock Gym in Everett, offering both toprope and lead


Meet at the left-side hexagonal picnic table next to the bench and cubbies.

I (Jens) will go up to the picnic table area from 7 - 7:15 PM to meet people who prefer to show up at the regular MeetUp time. Please check  the whiteboard near the bathrooms for a description of what I'm wearing. If anyone else arrives early, please write "MEETUP" and your name & what you are wearing on the Whiteboard.

If you have not already done so, please post a clear face picture of yourself on your profile so that I and other members can recognize you.

If arriving later, just come find us on the walls. Hopefully you can recognize me (see "Event Host" right) from my picture.

If you've never climbed here before, you'll need to take & pass a belay test for rope climbing. Call the gym or see the website below for more info. Full-access Day Pass $22. Bouldering-Only Pass $18. Free pizza for students.

More info and directions: http://www.metrorock.com/
results.how_to_find_us: At the picknic table next to the cubbies

results.description:
Burgers, beer, and warmer weather...Spring is here!

Welcome to our 2nd Tastings Around Boston event.

We have reserved the large upstairs cocktail lounge at Union St. in Newton specifically for you. Let's enjoy a beer flight, great selection of sliders (both vegetarian and meat), and fun conversation. 

If you haven't been to Union St. before, this is a great way to experience the venue. They have a great selection of beers (tap and bottle) and burgers (vegetarian and meat) on their regular menu; but not sliders. So, they will be preparing slider versions of all their burgers for us. Vegetarians will have 2 slider varieties, but as many of those as you'd like ;-). While there will be 4 different meat sliders.

SLIDER DETAILS:

• Classic Angus Slider -- bite size Angus burgers

• Harvest Turkey Slider -- Turkey, avocado, roasted beets, pea sprouts, goat cheese spread, blackberry mustard

• Buffalo Chicken Slider -- Crispy chicken, buffalo sauce, jalapenos, and crumbled blue cheese

• Toasted Tuscan Slider -- Eggplant, zucchini, peppers, arugula, artichokes, mozzarella & fontinella cheese, black olive spread

• Quinoa Slider -- House-made with roasted vegetables, quinoa, sweet potato & black beans

BEER DETAILS:

You will choose between either of the two available flights: Hop Sampler or Seasonal Sampler 


PAYMENT DETAILS:

Your payment of $40 will include tasty sliders (meat and vegetarian options), French fries, one beer flight, all taxes and gratuity, as well as the opportunity to meet great people. Your payment is requested at time of RSVP to hold your spot.


To ensure your spot is reserved, submit payment via one of the following four methods:


•  PayPal: Click here to access TABdetails quickly, "FRIENDS AND FAMILY" option. Or, search for [masked] once logged into your PayPal account.  

•  Venmo: TABdetails

• Google wallet:  [masked]

If none of these payment options work for you, we will accept cash at the door. Your spot will not be reserved and you must let either Sarah or Leah know this is your preference.


PARKING/TRANSPORTATION:

This location is across the street from the green line Newton Center stop. Otherwise, parking is all on the street. If you have any other tips to provide the group, please leave us comments. Thanks.

results.description:
Directed by Xie Jin. With Chen Qiang, Zhu Xijuan, Wang Xingang


China 1961, 35mm, color, 115 min. Mandarin with English subtitles

Xie Jin's powerful and colorful film tells the story of a young woman who escapes indentured servitude on Hainan Island in the 1930s to become a soldier fighting for revolution on the battlefield. A rousing potboiler that quickly became a classic, the film derives from a novel indirectly inspired by an actual women's battalion. The success of this version gave birth first to a 1964 ballet that was one of the eight so-called "model operas" and a film of the ballet made during the Cultural Revolution in 1971 (but not directed by Xie). It may well have been the success of this film that led to Xie’s rehabilitation by Jiang Qing. Despite—or perhaps because of—its revolutionary fervor, the film also reveals Xie to be a “poet of the libido,” in Tony Rayns’ phrase; the critic calls Red Detachment a “sexy tropical-gothic,” like the Powell-Pressburger Black Narcissus (1947).

See you at the movie,

John

results.description:
{Become replenished and relaxed as you and the other participants co-create a collective, healing heart field where everyone is nurtured.}

This Evening We Will ....

... work together sharing the power of our hearts.   Linda will help us create a safe container drawing upon our collective heart field.  We will do a 20 minute healing session that leaves everyone feeling nurtured, with participants taking on the roles of "client", "witness", and "helper" in EKP (Emotional-Kinesthetic Psychotherapy).   We will learn to observe body language and non-verbal cues, and have the opportunity to literally "lend a helping hand."  No matter which role you play, we will each feel nourished and supported. 


Linda will give us a chance to slow down and relax, in a space of emotional safety.  A tightness in the neck, a knot in the stomach or a heaviness in the heart is trying to give us a message about what we need.  Utilizing heart meditation, facilitated dialogue, and energetic tracking, we will tune in to subtle sensations in our bodies and hearts for healing, learning and self-care. 

Together, we will co-create a safe, supportive, healing community where heart-centered healing will touch us all. 

When we tap into the power of our hearts and share that power with one another, magical, transformational things are possible. 


To Prepare ....

1)  What is your experience of the "power of the heart?"  

2) When your body has tensions, aches, and other physical symptoms, what might it be trying to tell you? 

3) How can you listen through touch?

4) When you offer physical support, what non-verbal message do you convey?

Our Leader This Evening

Linda Marks, MSM, is a body-centered psychotherapist, lifework counselor, social architect, author, and singer/songwriter.  Through her work with individuals, couples and groups and her personal example, she helps others heal from the soul level up and create new heartfull possibilities for their lives. 

Emotional-safety is a cornerstone for her work, integrating emotional and physical heart health.

A pioneer in her field, she co-founded the first state body psychotherapy professional association in the U.S. in 1988.  She has been committed to founding organizations that bridge the gap between the individual and the collective for the past 30 years.  

She holds degrees from Yale and MIT.  Linda is the founder of the Institute for Emotional-Kinesthetic Psychotherapy, offering body psychotherapy traiinng using an apprenticeship model,  the Boston Area Sexuality and Spirituality Network, and served on the faculty of the College for Community and Public Service at UMass Boston.  She is a founding member of the United States Association for Body Psychotherapists.

Linda is the author of hundreds of articles and two books:
- Living with Vision
- Healing the War Between the Genders

You can reach her at [masked].

results.description:
Matthew Desmond discusses Evicted: Poverty and Profit in the American City

This event is free and includes a book signing; no tickets are required.

Friday, April 15th, 7pm

Harvard Book Store - 1256 Mass. Ave., Cambridge

Harvard Book Store welcomes John L. Loeb Associate Professor of the Social Sciences at Harvard University and co-director of the Justice and Poverty Project MATTHEW DESMOND for a discussion of his latest book, Evicted: Poverty and Profit in the American City. 

:: :: ::

About Evicted: In this brilliant, heartbreaking book, Matthew Desmond takes us into the poorest neighborhoods of Milwaukee to tell the story of eight families on the edge. Arleen is a single mother trying to raise her two sons on the $20 a month she has left after paying for their rundown apartment. Scott is a gentle nurse consumed by a heroin addiction. Lamar, a man with no legs and a neighborhood full of boys to look after, tries to work his way out of debt. Vanetta participates in a botched stickup after her hours are cut. All are spending almost everything they have on rent, and all have fallen behind.

The fates of these families are in the hands of two landlords: Sherrena Tarver, a former schoolteacher turned inner-city entrepreneur, and Tobin Charney, who runs one of the worst trailer parks in Milwaukee. They loathe some of their tenants and are fond of others, but as Sherrena puts it, “Love don’t pay the bills.” She moves to evict Arleen and her boys a few days before Christmas.

Even in the most desolate areas of American cities, evictions used to be rare. But today, most poor renting families are spending more than half of their income on housing, and eviction has become ordinary, especially for single mothers. In vivid, intimate prose, Desmond provides a ground-level view of one of the most urgent issues facing America today. As we see families forced  into shelters, squalid apartments, or more dangerous neighborhoods, we bear witness to the human cost of America’s vast inequality—and to people’s determination and intelligence in the face of hardship.

Based on years of embedded fieldwork and painstakingly gathered data, this masterful book transforms our understanding of extreme poverty and economic exploitation while providing fresh ideas for solving a devastating, uniquely American problem. Its unforgettable scenes of hope and loss remind us of the centrality of home, without which nothing else is possible.Praise

“Evicted is astonishing—a masterpiece of writing and research that fills a tremendous gap in our understanding of poverty. Taking us into some of America’s poorest neighborhoods, Desmond illustrates how eviction leads to a cascade of events, often triggered by something as simple as a child throwing a snowball at a car, that can trap families in a cycle of poverty for years. Beautiful, harrowing, and deeply human, Evicted is a must read for anyone who cares about social justice in this country. I loved it.” —Rebecca Skloot, author of The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks“Written with the vividness of a novel, [Evicted] offers a dark mirror of middle-class America’s obsession with real estate, laying bare the workings of the low end of the market, where evictions have become just another part of an often lucrative business model.” —New York Times

:: :: ::

Purchase the Book: Featured event books will be for sale at the event for 20% off. Thank you for supporting this author series with your purchases.

General Info: (617)[masked] - [masked]

Media Inquiries: (617)[masked] x1 - [masked]

Friday nights are generally for more experienced students, as we work through some different parts of Fiore's works in a more open format.  New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (c[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

results.description:
Join us for an evening of fun and connection as we play 3 communication games where we get the opportunity to say the truth and be real with each other (no touching and no one takes off any clothes). It's a great start to your evening! 

Imagine meeting new people in an environment where everyone feels comfortable to be themselves. It’s a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation—a place where everyone gets to say the truth. Through other people putting quality attention on you, and asking you questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening—really listening—to your responses, you have the opportunity to examine yourself. It’s a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good, which allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

You can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you. You don't have to do anything you don't want to, or answer any questions you don't want to answer. The games are designed to create the sensations in your body that you might have during Orgasmic Meditation* without having to actually do the practice—just through talking. What comes up might surprise you.

Even in a room full of strangers, it's amazing how connected we can end up feeling when we are willing to be authentic. It's like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in Boston. 

*At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation, which class or private training you can take with our masterful teachers and coaches, and what we have to offer so you can have more connection, authenticity, and play in your life!

$10, payable at the door.

Please arrive on time—we lock the door promptly at 7:40!

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave are only one block away (and free after 6pm). We are a 10-minute walk from the Red Line at Davis Square or Alewife station.

Nicole Daedone (founder of Orgasmic Meditation) on the science of OM:

results.description:
*************SPECIAL EVENT************************ 

I'm very pleased to be joined at our Intimate Puja Circle this evening by Crystal Guru Kyle Russell, who will be introducing us to the Crystal Concentrics perspective on using Power Stones for Grounding and Opening the Root Chakra.


BIO:  Kyle Russell has been working with Crystals for 29 years, since the Harmonic Convergence of 1987 - when he had a transformative experience that left him with an enormous amount of information about Crystals - quite independent of the existing Crystal Lore. 


Since then, he's developed paradigms - a Language of Crystals - which he employs through Workshops and Meditations (Live & Online) - to share his knowledge and understanding. 


Simultaneously, Kyle has developed a world class collection of Power Stones - which he also buys and sells - showcasing at his wellness space in Arlington (MA), as well at Metaphysical Fairs and Expos from New York through New England.


Feel free to contact [masked] with any questions.

_____________________________________

A Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual/practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source.  


_________________________________________

Here's what we are going to do:

_________________________________________

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn, of Come Back to Love, will be the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation - the principles and practices of Sacred Sexuality

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, expanded orgasm, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with many invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience Tantric Speed Dating as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

Here's what Participants are saying!

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."


The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZES8HVDSP97PA"></a> itself will begin part-way through the night during which you'll have the chance to connect more deeply with others (one-on-one) -- this part of the evening will be facilitated, with a structure offered, however, you will have ample time to co-create with the beloved in front of you!!  

You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.

There is no overt sexuality in the Intimate Puja Circle workshops and events.  You will be asked to abide by our guidelines of consent with everything you do and everyone you interact with.  This is a safe environment in which people get to explore their boundaries and have them honored in a respectful, loving way.  

If you are looking for a sexual environment, there are other groups that offer such things.  Tantra is a deep and ancient Spiritual practice that guides us back home, to love.  

Q&A

1. What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle.  These rituals will be invitations to connect with yourself and one another - and you will be at choice as to how you do that.  There are typically a mix of singles and couples at the events.

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist; bring sarongs, scarves, dresses, etc.

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS!!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

4.  What if I have questions, I'm feeling a bit nervous:  Please email me to set up a time to talk:  [masked]

April 15th Dance Friday hosts: Spiral Kinesis: Dancing With The Beloved from 8:00-9:00 led by Ro'i Rose, followed by Freestyle dancing with dj Nancy Farber. Join us from 8:00 pm - 11:30pm at The First Parish Cambridge Unitarian Universalist Church, 3 Church St., Cambridge, MA. (Doors will open at 7:45 for warm–up prior to class.)

In the course of an hour, Ro’i will lead us through a spiral kinetic journey into the heart of ourselves. Beginning with standing meditation, we will practice the Four Core principles of Spiral Kinesis in standing, sitting, moving and interactive meditation.

Come play in the Unified Field! Spiral Kinesis unites the body technologies of the Sufi and Daoist traditions with the latest research into Quantum Physics and Body Mechanics. The result is an integrated system of movement that widens our spacial awareness and makes an ideal transition into conscious, ecstatic dance.

Exchange: $10-15 for dance only, $15-20 for the entire experience

Please arrive by 8pm to ensure inclusion in the class. I have been preparing a tight 1-hour experience, and would be grateful for warmed up bodies to share it with me.

Exercises to include Outer Dissolving, Daoist Breathing, and Co-Creating the Cauldron.

Be prepared to release your worries to the Void and breathe new Life into your dreams.

Our container will be closed for an hour from approximately 8-9pm and will re-open for 2.5 hours of ecstatic dance.

Harvard-educated and Tibetan-trained, Ro’i Rose has been practicing the Chinese martial, medical, and meditational arts since 1990.  In 2007, he founded Spiral Kinesis, a synthesis of multicultural movement arts with the physics of sacred geometry.  More information can be found at SpiralKinesis.com. After class, enjoy dancing to music by Nancy Farber. The fabulous, fun-filled event begins with a class from 8:00 to 9:00 and continues with dj'd dancing until 11:30pm. Music provided by some extraordinary DJs.  Dancers of all ages and abilities are invited to dance barefoot, any way you like, with or without a partner, in a smoke, alcohol and scent–free environment. Children are welcome.


Dance Friday is an activity of the non–profit Movement Collective. Suggested Donation: $15 8pm-9:15, $10-15 after 9:30, $5-10 after 11,  under  23 years old $5-15, or donate 45 minutes of your time to help out. We recommend casual, light-weight, comfortable clothing that you can move in.

For more information, please call: 6I[masked], go to <a>www.dancefriday.org,</a> or visit us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/#/pages/Dance-Friday/[masked]?ref=ts

About Three Dog Night

Legendary music icons, THREE DOG NIGHT, celebrate their 4th decade bringing with them some of the most astonishing statistics in popular music. In the years 1969 through 1974, no other group achieved more top 10 hits, moved more records or sold more concert tickets than THREE DOG NIGHT. 

THREE DOG NIGHT’s hits wind through the fabric of pop culture today, whether on the radio where they are heard day in and day out, in TV commercials or in major motion pictures -- songs like “Mama Told Me (Not To Come)”, “Joy to the World”, “Black and White”, “Shambala” and “One” serve to heighten our emotions and crystallize THREE DOG NIGHT’s continuing popularity.

This Grammy-nominated band is not content resting on their legacy alone. Always working to expand their audience, THREE DOG NIGHT have embraced and been embraced by 21st century music technology. New fans buy THREE DOG NIGHT’s music on iTunes as well as at record stores. In fact, their releases from this decade alone have sold well over a million and a half albums and the band’s continued popularity has landed “The Best of Three Dog Night : 20th Century Masters” on the Billboard Top 200 Album Chart for 9 of the last 12 months. 

Recently, Three Dog Night began adding new songs to their arsenal by releasing their first double-A sided single in nearly 25 years. The blistering performance of "Heart Of Blues" and the timely, beautiful a-cappella ballad "Prayer of the Children” are available online at iTunes,Amazon.com and other digital retailers as well as through the official band website (www.threedognight.com), and their Facebook and MySpace sites. 

Now, as they mark more than 40 years on the road, THREE DOG NIGHT continue to grow their fan base and travel the country giving concerts at theatres, performing arts centers, fairs, festivals, corporate events, and casinos. Since 1986, they have performed over 2,200 shows including two Super Bowls. The band's current lineup includes Danny Hutton, Michael Allsup, Paul Kingery, Pat Bautz, Eddie Reasoner, and David Morgan.
results.name: Salisbury Rockin - "3 Dog Night" - Blue Ocean - Salisbury, MA

results.description:
THIS WORKSHOP IS SOLD OUT AS OF 4/12! YOU MUST BE REGISTERED VIA WLFARM.ORG TO ATTEND.

Registration open to kids ages 8 and up, too! (with adult participant) Learn about the night sky with former science journalist and research astronomer Dr. Joshua Roth. Along with budding trees and chirping birds, April brings the spring constellations into view while holding on to some of the showpieces of winter. This year we are blessed with vernal views of Jupiter, blazing overhead all night as the king of the planets. This 90-minute program will mix slides, interactive activities, and outdoor stargazing with telescopes, binoculars, and the unaided eye. Be sure to dress for the weather (layers are recommended; if it’s clear, it may be quite chilly). Bring your telescope or binoculars if you have them. No dogs are allowed during the workshop.

This workshop will be held rain or shine (activities will continue in the 1827 Barn in the case of inclement weather).

Tuition fee: $10 per person

Click here to register: https://www.wlfarm.org/get-involved?page=CiviCRM&q=civicrm/event/register&reset=1&id=245

This workshop is hosted by Wright-Locke Farm.
results.name: Spring Stargazing Workshop

We are shifting the time back an hour to start at 8PM starting this Friday. Please note the time change.

Here's the game plan:

8:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

8:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

8:20 - Play!!!!!!

10:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

results.description:
Join your fellow cloudah-heads at the Watertown edition of the 2016 Global Azure Bootcamp. As in the past, the Boston area will play host to two simultaneous events - this one at Blue Metal Architects at Watertown Square in Watertown, and another at District Hall in Boston.

At the Watertown event, we will be specifically focusing on the IoT and Machine Learning capabilities of Microsoft Azure. In doing so, we will be touching a lot of the services offered in Azure, but not directly covering them in detail. Prior experience with Azure is helpful, but not required.

Plan to bring your laptop and provision at least a free trial Azure account BEFORE you come to the event (see below for details).  It is important to come prepared: getting set up is not terribly difficult, but it takes a while for things to run.  

WHAT WILL THE DAY LOOK LIKE?

1.  Doors open at 8:30 – fuel up with some food and coffee, grab a seat, get on the wifi, warm up your twitter account (#GlobalAzure and  #bostonazure).

2.  Bootcamp activities begins promptly at 9:15 - Welcome / About The Day / Start Your Engines

3.  IoT Hands-On Workshop

4.  ~ 12:00 – Lunch from Panera

5.  Azure Machine Learning and some Advanced Analytics (time permitting)

6.  4:30ish – wrap up content, next steps, SWAG (and, yes, have a LOT of SWAG)

7.  5:00pm – done!


HOW DO I PREPARE FOR THE DAY?   UPDATED on 4/15/[masked]:30 p.m.

- Azure Account - 

https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/

- Visual Studio 2015 (the free community edition is sufficient)

https://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/products/vs-2015-product-editions.aspx

- Visual Studio 2015 Update 2 - 

https://www.visualstudio.com/news/vs2015-update2-vs

- Azure SDK 2.9 (for Visual Studio 2015) - 

https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-visual-studio-azure-tools-and-sdk-2-9/

- Azure PowerShell 1.3.0 – 

http://aka.ms/webpi-azps

- Windows 10 Core IoT Templates -

https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/55b357e1-a533-43ad-82a5-a88ac4b01dec

- Go to the Bing Maps Portal, sign in and request a developer key -

https://www.bingmapsportal.com

- Install the Bing Maps WPF Control - 

https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=27165

HOW DO I CONNECT THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA?

Twitter:  #GlobalAzure and #bostonazure
results.how_to_find_us: If using a GPS, use 24 Pleasant Street as the address; that will provide access to our FREE parking lot. We are part of the Riverbend Office Park complex directly at the MBTA Watertown Square bus stop. The office is on the 3rd floor.
results.name: 2016 Global Azure IoT/Machine Learning Bootcamp - Watertown

results.description:
We'll take a nice and easy ride from here to there and enjoy a little lunch and friendly get together.  We'll tell lies about how bad our backs hurt from shoveling snow and how our toes hurt from the freezing cold!!

So charge up your batteries, check your air pressure and check your oil and lets ride.
results.name: Take 2: Lets clean off our bikes and take a warm up ride to the Vanilla Bean

results.description:
We will run down Comm Ave in the carriage lane to the Chestnut Hill/BC reservoir, with the option to run around the reservoir before turning around. This is an out and back course so the distance is flexible - you can run however many miles you want!  There are some hills - we will run 3 of the 4 Newton Hills along the Boston Marathon course (if you go at least 8 miles - 4 out and 4 back).

Meet outside at the tables next to Bruegger's and the ATM.  We will leave right at 8:30 AM (especially when it is cold out!).

The pace will vary depending on who shows up.  If there is a wide range of paces, we frequently end up splitting into smaller groups based on pace.  Even if your pace doesn't "match up" with anyone else, meeting up with the group and starting the run with everyone is a great way to get yourself out of bed on those early Saturday mornings!
results.name: Comm Ave long run  8-15+ miles

results.description:
This is the year that the BSOT will hike the M&M/New England National Scenic Trail from north to south, at least to the Connecticut border, starting at Grand Monadnock.  The plan is to hike one section every 2-3 weeks over the course of the spring, summer, into the fall.  We’ll see how far we get!

The M&M Trail, named for the Metacomet Ridge and Mount Monadnock (not the candy. Not the rapper, either. Sorry).  From the web link:

The New England National Scenic Trail (NET) is a 215-mile trail route that has been in existence for over half a century. It travels through 39 communities in Connecticut and Massachusetts, and is comprised primarily of the historic Mattabesett, Metacomet, and Monadnock (M-M-M) Trails.  The route showcases classic New England landscape features: long distance vistas with rural towns as a backdrop, agrarian lands, un-fragmented forests, and large river valleys. The trail also travels through important Native American and colonial historical landmarks and highlights a range of diverse ecosystems and natural resources: trap-rock ridges, mountain summits, forested glades, vernal pools, lakes, streams and waterfalls.

http://amcberkshire.org/netmm

http://amcberkshire.org/mmguide

Not all sections of the M&M/NET Trail are presently passable and several sections north of Belchertown to the NH border follow paved roads.  Most of these paved sections we’ll skip.

Most sections will be rated Easy/Moderate to Moderate/Difficult.  Checkout the Difficulty Ratings I use at:

http://hikenewengland.com/LegendRating.html

And, as we’ll be section hikers almost all sections will require car spotting. 

On this first section we’ll make our way to the summit of Grand Monadnock (trailhead to be determined) then head southeast on the M&M Trail to RT 12 in Troy, NH.  Total distance of 9 miles, difficulty rating of Moderate/Difficult with an elevation gain of  2000+’.  With car spotting expect to spend 7-8 hours with the group.

Carpooling is welcome.  If you would like to carpool you're welcome to post that request in the *Comments* section of this event's page.  But please respond to those posts via *Meetup Messenger*.  You do that by clicking on a member's profile, then clicking on *message*..

Cell Phones and Electronic Devices: 

I ask that while on the BSOT events that I host you limit your use of electronic devices to the following activities:

Map My Hike or other Hiking Apps

Location Services

Cameras

Weather Apps

Of the many pleasant features of being out and about is that we all get away from the constant distractions of cell phones and electronics.  I ask that while on the events I host you:

Do not use your phone (of course! I make exceptions for emergencies and calling a taxi/Uber if you can't make it back on foot!)

Do not listen to the radio.

Do not play music.

Thank you in advance for respecting this request.


THE FINE PRINT: 

No dogs or guests are allowed on BSOT hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event.

You need a recognizable facial photo as your profile picture in order to participate in this and all Trekkers events.

Duration: Approximately 6+ hours. However, any time estimate given by an Event Organizer is just that. Actual times vary greatly according to weather, trail conditions and the group itself. Don't sign up if you've scheduled something later in the day. The Organizer is not responsible for getting you back in time.

There is no way of knowing trail conditions ahead of time. Use your own judgment. Anyone with recurrent "No Shows" or about whom we have received complaints from fellow hikers will not be accepted. If you haven't hiked with us before, add yourself to the list if you can adhere to these basic prerequisites. Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. We are committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up.

This hike is rated Moderate/Difficult.  You should be able to stay with the group going at a pace of 2+ mph. This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy snow or extreme cold weather cancels. Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers), bug spray and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event. 

Please remember that your Event Organizers are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree (woof!). If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

By clicking the "Yes" option on the RSVP link you are agreeing to the Liability Waiver as stated below: 

Remember: Your Event Organizers are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you have read and agree to adhere to the safety standards detailed @ http://www.hikesafe.com/; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason.
results.name: The M&M/New England Scenic Trail: Section 1

results.description:
The #GlobalAzure event is a free all-day hands-on event where you can come and learn about Azure from experts (like Mark Eisenberg, Udai Ramachandran, Jason Haley, Slava Kokaev, James Sturtevant, Nazik Huq, George Babey, and Bill Wilder). It is coordinated across more than 100 event sites AROUND THE WORLD on a single day.

Plan to BRING YOUR LAPTOP (preparation instruction are listed below) for hands-on experience.

This is one of two locations. This location is District Hall in Boston not far from South Station (see below for exact address and map). (The other location is in Watertown at Blue Metal.)

Okay to start signing up. More details about the agenda to come, but for reference you can see what we did last year.

Sincerely,

@bostonazure

WHEN

Saturday April 16, 2016. Doors open at 9:00 AM. Event begins at 9:30.

FOOD

We have ordered food for 75 people for breakfast and lunch. We will wrap up before dinner.

LOCATION

District Hall
75 Northern Avenue
Boston, MA 02210 

MAP

Google:  https://bit.ly/1T3JPN0


Bing: https://bit.ly/1Sfm3Rj

Venue: http://www.districthallboston.org/contact/

PUBLIC TRANSPORATION


Short walk from South Station (about 3/4 mile).

PARKING

http://en.parkopedia.com/parking/lot/25_northern_ave/02210/boston/


Around $20, according to http://boston.bestparking.com/

Parking guidance from District Hall: "Parking: Please use one of the many parking lots in the area or bring quarters for the meters (Brew and Gather can not make change)."

SPONSORS

Big thanks to HealthcareSource, BlueMetal, Microsoft, and District Hall! This event would not be possible without their help.

HOW DO I PREPARE FOR THE DAY?

Please save time and do these things before Saturday!


1. Microsoft Azure Account. You will need a functioning Azure account. If you have an MSDN subscription (Pro or higher), you may already have an account; otherwise, obtain a free 30-day trial (with $200 of Azure services).


2. Install Visual Studio 2015. Download the Community Edition if you don't already have it installed.  I would also recommend installing Update 2.


3. Install the Windows Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2015 development (VS 2015 under .NET).

If you installed VS update 2, you may already have 2.9 installed.

AGENDA (in flux until delivered!)

• 09:00 AM - doors open - sign in at desk, grab breakfast and coffee, set up laptop, ...

• 9:30 AM - Breakfast provided


• 09:30 AM - BEGIN!

• 09:35 AM - Keynote / Cloud Overview (Mark Eisenberg)

• 10:55 AM - Microservices & Service Fabric + Lab (Udai Ramachandran)

• 12:30 PM - Lunch provided

• 1:00 PM - Web Jobs + Lab (Jason Haley)


• 2:15 PM - Feel the Power! Power BI + Lab (Slava Kokaev)

• 3:30 PM - Azure Functions (Jason Haley)

• 4:00 PM - (buffer or add'l talk or Azure Lightning)

• 5:00 PM - Azure Web Sites + Lab (Jason Haley)


• 5:45 - LAST SESSION ENDS


• 6:00 PM - DONE!

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked] 


=====

Do you like to hike?

Do you like to hike with others?

Have you ever wanted to organize and lead your own hikes?

We are always looking for people to organize and lead their own trips. We keep our groups small so most of our trips fill up pretty quickly - there are always people on the waiting list that would like to meet up for a hike. If there are more hikes on the calendar that means more people get to spend time out on the trails.

I put together a brief summary of what we expect from organizers and what organizers can expect from the group, along with a step-by-step outline to plan a trip, but I thought the best way to find out what it's all about is to head out into the woods and figure it out. So if you want to be an organizer with the group this is the event for you.

• http://www.meetup.com/random-hikers/pages/Expectations_of_Organizers_with_the_Random_Group


• http://files.meetup.com/492954/Trip_Planning.pdf


=== What We're Doing ===

The plan is to hike to one of the 4,000 footers in New Hampshire - Moosiluake. We will use Glencliff Trail and the Moosilauke Carriage Road to reach the summit and then follow the same route in reverse to get back to the trailhead. While most of the route will be in the trees, the final section is above treeline.

We will stop along the way and take time at the summit to talk about what it's all about. Be prepared to ask a lot of questions because we will be ready to answer them!

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.


RSVPs close 24 hours before the event.

Guests aren't permitted.


Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===


We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 7.8 miles and climb about 3,400 feet. It should take an average hiker about 5 hours 45 minutes to complete (this time doesn't include breaks). This event is considered INTERMEDIATE because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

Use this link for more information about where we are going and how we will get there:

• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/10-Mt-Moosilauke-4802

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants.


Use this link for the current weather forecast:

• http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.0239277895134&lon=-71.83204650878906#.VvXmizawlrV


=== What to Bring ===


We might still need traction - either Kahtoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons - but we won't need snowshoes!

Use this link for a list of items needed for a three season day hike:


• http://files.meetup.com/492954/Three_Season_Dayhike_gear_list.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

=== Directions ===

We will meet in the parking lot on the east side of High Street in Benton, NH. According to Google Maps this spot is about 136 miles from Boston and it should take about 2 hours 28 minutes to drive there


Use this link to customize the driving directions:

• https://goo.gl/maps/ceoZu6zKztk

</a>

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

=== Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer ===

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the <a href="http://www.hikesafe.com/">Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
Golf season is not too far away. 

Please let me know if you are interested in signing up for the Saturday a.m. mixed league at Middleton Golf Course. 

The league plays from 4/16 through 8/27 and there are contests and prizes each week.


This is a par 3 course so you can practice your short game.  The fee to join is $40 and it covers your handicap fee.  You can play 9 or 18 but have to decide which option when you sign up each week.

This league is flexible!

Tee times are from 7:30 to 10:30 and you are NOT required to play every week.  I will make the tee time the week of play and it is usually around 9-10 am until it gets hot and then 8-9 am.

The website is www.middletongolf.com

There are leagues every day if Saturday does not fit your schedule.

After an introduction of different mushroom growing methods, we will teach you how to inoculate logs with shiitake mushroom spawn and send you home with your own “seeded” log which can provide mushrooms for up to 5 years. results.description:
Come paddle at one of our practice sessions with Living Root, your 2015 Boston Dragon Boat Festival Grand Champions! We're a social and friendly co-ed team who enjoy the sport of dragon boat paddling.

Are you new to paddling? No problem! We'll show you everything you need to know to paddle on a dragon boat. This is a great way to meet people, get in shape, and do something fun in the sun.

We paddle rain or shine, so dress for the weather. Wear comfortable workout clothing and footwear that you don't mind getting wet. Bring a bottle of water, and we'll provide all the paddling equipment you'll need and a place to lock up your belongings. We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice. So come join us! Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked].

Additional Location and Parking information can be found here

Check out our website or find us on Facebook!

results.description:
Their major issue is that they have tons of donations, and not even close enough amount of volunteers, to sort useable vs. recycle goods.  

http://thewishproject.org/ 

The Wish Project is a non-profit dedicated to providing free furniture, home goods, baby goods, and clothing to people in need in the Merrimack Valley, primarily through reuse and recycling. They serve thousands of people each year, and rely on the help of many volunteers. Let's be some of those volunteers! We'll take on whatever task they need on this day, but generally it involves sorting and organizing donations so they can be given out to clients. Children ages 8+ are welcome to join the effort. It's a great opportunity to teach your kids compassion in a very hands-on way. 

IMPORTANT:

If you are bringing children, please make a note in the comments section so I can give the Wish Project an accurate count of adults and kids who will be attending.

http://thewishproject.org/

 *PLEASE NOTE:  When you RSVP 'yes' it becomes a commitment. I am in contact with the volunteer coordinator, Patty, whom is now a member, giving her a head count. She then creates a list of things that need to be done -relying upon the number of volunteers. If your plans change, please be considerate -take a moment to update your RSVP to 'no.' It's very simple- and greatly appreciated! Thanks :)

results.description:
Note:  You must sign up at www.llbean.com/dedham to reserve your spot.  See note at end of description

Join L.L.Bean Dedham for a trip to Purgatory Chasm in Rocky Woods Reservation in Medfield, MA. This trip will pass several ponds, go through open woods and ascend through the rocky and narrow Purgatory Chasm, finally terminating at the summit with its open view to the Southwest.

If you haven't done this hike before, it's easy to moderate and has a lot of variety of terrain.  The chasm and the summit are real fun.  The hike is around 4 miles total.

Bring weather appropriate clothing, water for 2 and a half hours, hiking worthy footwear, bug repellent (there's a lot of deer in Rocky Woods), snacks.

Rocky Woods Reservation is a Trustees site and admittance is $4 for non-members or free if you are a member.

Note:  This meetup attendee list will always list ONE person (the organizer), with the meetup being "FULL".  This is to ensure that attendees sign up at www.llbean.com/dedham to sign up.  We do this so there aren't TWO competing attendee lists (one meetup, one llbean).  See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in second lot after the entrance to Rocky Woods Reservation
results.name: Hike the Purgatory Chasm at Rocky Woods Reservation

results.description:
Note:  Pose will be the same as the Friday 4-hour sessions, so if you want to get a REALLY long pose, sign up for both.  

Jeremy Durling will host- Jeremy's paintings are available through the Sloane Merrill Gallery on Charles Street in Boston.  

Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $55, non-members for $70.    Three hours each Saturday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at

http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html


PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $55 or $65 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.description:
Let's meet and walk for at least an hour. Our route Saturday will be thru town, up Prospect Street, (a rather large hill) over to Rowley Bridge Road, left at Cross Street, (another large hill), Salem Road, River Road, Prospect St, down the hill  and back downtown.   Our walks are brisk.  You will get your heart rate up.  Most walking will be on the street, some will be on sidewalks.  Following our walk, we frequently get a coffee/tea at one of the shops in town.

Hope you can make it!  It's fun!

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/North-Shore-Womens-Group/events/229051918/#"></a>
results.name: Walk  in Topsfield...

results.description:
We leave Longwood and progress up 17-92 to

Blue Springs

https://www.floridastateparks.org/park/Blue-Spring

2100 W French Ave

Orange City, FL 32763

Blue Spring is a first magnitude spring on the St. John's River.   We'll walk back to see the springs and take the self-guided tour thru  The Historic Thursby house, built in 1872. 

Fees:

Admission Fee:  $6.00 per vehicle. Limit 2-8 people per vehicle.$4.00 Single Occupant Vehicle. $2.00 Pedestrians, bicyclists, extra passengers, passengers in vehicle with holder of Annual Individual Entrance Pass. (You will be responsible for this yourself--if we double up in cars then we can share it with the driver as worked out individually)

After we complete this we will continue up 17-92 to Deland for lunch

River Town Café

https://rivertowncafe.joomla.com/

442 East 
New York Ave.
DeLand, Florida 

Haven't tried it before, but their logo:  A Unique Translation of Comfort Food sounded intriguing to me.

Then on to 17-92 again to

Barberville Pioneer Village

http://www.pioneersettlement.org/

1776 Lightfoot Lane
Barberville, Florida

General Admission—Self-Guided Tours

$8/each Adults

$7/each Seniors (60+), Veterans and Groups of 5 or more

Again you pay the facility yourself I will not be taking any money.  This is a collection of historical buildings brought from all over Florida and now set up for your viewing pleasure.

We'll leave here and return back to Longwood.  If you live closer to the springs and/or Deland you can contact me about meeting you elsewhere along the route.  If you sign up and can't make it please let me know.  I had 9 people signed up last time, only 2 showed....thanks.
results.how_to_find_us: Pep Boys is on SW corner and behind is a parking lot ...I'll be waiting there.
results.name: See Blue Springs--Eat in Deland and Wander History in Barberville

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Our charity gaming event is a go!

For those who weren't aware, I've joined the Home Away Boston Marathon Team with my girlfriend Meaghan in honor of her Mom, Judi, who is currently fighting her battle with brain cancer.

To describe Home Away simply, I'll share the first words you see when visiting their website:


When the parents of a critically ill child are told to leave home and seek medical treatment in Boston, the first question they ask is "Where will we stay?" and often the second question is "How will we afford this?"

...
This is where Home Away Boston steps in and provides housing to the families of these kids while they're receiving treatment at Mass General Hospital.

True to form, Judi thought of children first, so that is where we chose to focus our fund raising efforts.

On Saturday, April 16th, 2016 we'll be providing a space for an 8 hour board game marathon. For a donation of $25 (per adult) at the door you'll be able to come and play for the full 8 hours, receive lunch and dinner, and be automatically entered into drawings for door pizes which will consist of board games on the "Current Hotness" list (at least 10 of them).

There will be plenty of games available to play along with people to teach them, but also feel free to bring some of your own as well if there is something specific you would like to get to the table.

There will also be other opportunities at the event, for small donations, to take home other game related prizes (like play to win, and possibly an auction).

Meaghan and I, and her family, would very much appreciate your support. Our goal is to have at least 50 people come to the event, but the more the merrier of course! Please consider coming to hangout with friends, eat good food, play some games, maybe win some games, and have a fun day.

Please share this with anyone you think might be interested. All are welcome! Kids too!

Thanks,
Paul & Meaghan

http://www.homeawayboston.org/

PS: For those who cannot attend but would still like to help, you can donate through our team's funding page online.

https://www.crowdrise.com/homeawayboston2016/fundraiser/paulleoncavallo/
results.name: Boston Marathon Charity Gameday for Home Away Boston

results.description:
Shamanic Journey with Grace Germaine Walsh, Reiki Shamanism Master Teacher/Practitioner.


 This class is for anyone, whether you are new to journeying or not.

In this program you will enter a deep, spiritual experience in non-ordinary reality by meeting, greeting and traveling with your own personal power animals and guides.  This  workshop introduces you to the shamanic journey; an altered state of awareness that is a powerful tool used for healing, spiritual guidance and assistance in our daily lives. Grace drums for you as you learn to journey yourself to connect with your power animal(s) as well as receive a healing from the higher realms.
During the course of the day, we will journey 3 times….first to Lower World (subconscious) to meet and explore with our power animal; then to Upper World (higher consciousness) to meet a guide and either ask for a healing or to answer a question. The last journey of the day will be to Middle World (this world); which is a powerful “spiritual” view at our “physical” world; one that enables us to view our ‘ordinary’ reality through “non- ordinary” eyes.
     Please bring a light lunch, water, a blanket and pillow, eye cover and a notebook or journal to record your experiences. We will be breaking for lunch mid-day, staying in the room to hold the energy of our space.
    Grace is skilled at the craft of Shamanic journeying, having trained as a first apprentice with Jim Pathfinder Ewing (Nvnehi Awatisgi), a renowned Native American healer and shaman. 

 This class is for anyone, whether you are new to journeying or not. This class meets partial requirement for certification in Reiki Shamanism. For a full description of Levels 1 and 2 of Reiki Shamanism certification, click here.  OR copy/paste this address into your browser:

http://ahigherbalance.com/training-and-certification/reiki/
results.name: Shamanic Journey Day-Long Training

results.description:
Join Members and Guests of Social Fun (SF) and South Shore Hike Bike & Social Club (SSHBSC) for our 2nd Annual (and 3rd non-consecutive) Saturday Morning Blue Hills Walk/Beginner-Friendly Hike! It's time to get back outdoors and start our hikes!  We will start off with a Walk/Beginner Friendly Hike at Houghton's Pond @ Blue Hills. This walk/hike is a Green-Dot Trail with some pavement.  We walk/hike 2 looped paths which take about 15-20 minutes each.  It really and truly is a walk and easy hike.  We will walk/hike for about 45 minutes to an hour (or more), depending on the will of the group.  This will cover approximately 1.5-3 miles.  If we walk both loops twice we'll cover a good 2-2.5 miles.  (I'll measure each loop for us that day w/ an app on my phone.)  We'll meet by the map at Houghton's Pond main parking lot.

Things to bring: Water, [a light snack,] sun block, sun glasses, comfortable walking shoes/boots, and dress in layers.

Optional: For those who are interested, we may go to Newcomb Farms on Route 28 in Milton (5 minutes up the road) for an early lunch or late breakfast, whichever suits your fancy, or we may simply have a picnic.  If you are interested for sure please let us know in the comments section.  Please bring cash as the restaurant does not accept credit cards.

If anyone wants to carpool from Braintree Town Hall, I will be leaving promptly @ 9:30am and can accommodate 3-4 passengers.  Please comment in the "Carpool" conversation on the event wall if you will be joining the carpool.


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Blue Hills Walk/Beginner-Friendly Hike!

Saturday, April 16th @ 10-11:30am

Houghton's Pond @ Blue Hills 
840 Hillside Street 
Milton, MA 
Blue Hills Website: http://www.mass.gov/dcr

Meeting Location: Meet by the map in the main parking lot near the Visitor's Center.


Event Host(s)/Organizer(s): Angela & Alison ~ Thank you, Alison, for stepping up to co-host this event.

Min/Max: At least 8 Yes RSVPs (and a co-host, preferably) 10 days prior to the event between both groups.  Maximum is 20 between both groups, which will be increased by 5 once we have a Co-Host (for each group). The Wait List is Automatic, you will be moved from the WL to the Yes list in the order in which you RSVP'd.

Guests: Welcome!  One adult (21+) per member.  We will open this event up to guests approximately 3 weeks prior to the event.

Cost/Fees:  There are currently no costs or fees associated with this event.  Houghton's Pond does have some donation bins if you so wish to do so.  If you want to make your annual voluntary contribution to Social Fun I will be happy to collect and mail it to Biagio.

RSVP Deadline: Please finalize your RSVP by 8:30am on Saturday, April 16th.  Any changes made after this time may not be seen by an Event Organizer prior to the event and are subject to our No-Show policy.  Please be kind enough to change your RSVP (even if it's after the deadline) if you are unable to attend.  **Please note you can still RSVP up until 1 hour prior to the event.  I simply won't have you on my RSVP printout.**

Inclement Weather: Heavy rains will cancel. We will walk if it is overcast or there is a slight drizzle. Please plan to bring a jacket with a hood just in case. (We will do our best to notify everyone if this event is cancelled by 9am on the day of the walk.)  *Please check back here for an update approximately 24-48 hours prior to the event.*  Any cancellation decisions will be made around the RSVP Deadline.

Rain/Date: Sunday, April 17th @ 10-11:15am

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions:

For those with a GPS, the address is 840 Hillside Street, Milton, MA.

Take Route 93 to Exit 3, Houghton's Pond. Turn right at the end of the exit (from 93SB, left from 93NB). Follow road to the end passing a couple of small parking lots on your right.  At the end of the road (at the stop sign) turn right onto Hillside Street. Houghton's Pond is located approximately 1/4 mile on the right.  (If you go the wrong way off the highway you will know it pretty quickly as it's a dead-end on the other side.)

Parking: Free and ample parking in lot adjacent to our meeting location.  (The directions take you to this lot.)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Note: All of my events are child-free and pet-free for adults 21+ only unless otherwise noted.  Thank you for being respectful of this request. 

Please Note: Effective March 31st, 2016, most of my meetup events will be limited to a max of 10 participants until we get a Co-Host, at which time we should be able to open up at least 5 more spots.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet by the map in the main parking lot near the Visitor's Center.
results.name: Blue Hills Walk/Beginner Friendly Hike!

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Come around to the right side of the school (left side of the church), enter under the green awning, then up two flights to the gym!
results.name: (Cambridge) - Intermediate Swordplay, Dagger and Grappling

group.name: Boston Armizare -- Historical Swordplay and More!

results.description:
Every Saturday morning at 10:00 AM we gather for a fun, calming group run at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir. Both walkers and runners are welcome. Our main goal is to socialize and support one another!

The Boston Bulldogs is a co-ed non-profit running club founded to support those battling addiction and in recovery, those who have been affected by addiction and their supporters.

We welcome and encourage runners of all levels – dreamers, beginners, as well as those with running experience, past or present. Our volunteer runners will be there to coach you at your current level, and help you meet your goals. We might even be able to help with running gear if needed. 

We meet twice weekly at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir (Cleveland Circle/Reservoir Green Line C or D train) -- on Saturday mornings at 10:00 AM and Thursday evenings at 6:30 PM. We first gather in front of the Cleveland Circle Starbucks, before heading over to the reservoir. See you there!

If you are interested in becoming a member or a volunteer, in making a contribution to the Club, in sponsoring a runner in recovery, or in learning more about the Boston Bulldog educational wellness/running program, contact us at:

• Website - BostonBulldogsRunning.com

• Email - [masked] 

• Phone -[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We will start gathering outside the Starbucks at Cleveland Circle around 9:45am... see you then!
results.name: Saturday's Group Fun Run

(This year, Eric will not be hosting all of the weekend meetups, even though he is always listed as attending -- because Meetup does this automatically as a side effect of Eric scheduling them :)

results.description:
IMPORTANT-DISCLAIMER: We are not the event host. People usually just show up and play: no RSVP necessary or fees. Players from this group can just meet and play and network.

Pick-up soccer every Saturday and Sunday at 10:00 am at Magazine Beach in Cambridge. People just show up and play; no RSVP or fees.

To show your support, download our Djamga - ShowUpAndPlaySports App to Find more pick up games in the city of Boston or anywhere in the world.  Get Djamga App for iOS and  or Djamga App for  Android.

Don't forget to post your feedback after the game to help us curate and  post more reliable pick up games.
results.name: [Sat & Sun ] Co-Ed Pick Up Soccer at Magazine beach at 10am - Free

results.description:
Please make sure to RSVP at this meetup event and checkin when you come in for the run.


Group run logistics: Please come prepared for a short run (or run/walk). Leave your bags, etc. at home or in your car so that you can run easily. Please make sure to arrive 10 minutes early to look for parking, find the location, etc.  


Coach will brief you at the beginning of the run about the distance (~3 or 4 miles) and direct you through stretching exercises. It is absolutely OK to run/walk in the beginning. Many of us are first-time runners. So please don’t be shy :-). 

Parking: Please arrive 10+ minutes early to find parking near MIT. Suggested locations are Memorial drive (free) Mass Ave (metered), Vassar Street (metered, paid lot). More options see this map.

Program details:  TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fund-raising program. We train runners for their full or half marathon races and runners raise donations for AID and Asha. Both beginner and experienced runners are welcome. Anyone is welcome to RSVP and join us for the group runs up to four time with no obligations. We request formal registrations after attending four group runs.

If you missed the information session please review the overview slides/videos here.

Looking for more runners: We are always looking for more runners. If any of your friends, family members or colleagues to give us a try and join this meetup group.


Waiver: Lawyers make us do this :-).  By running with TeamAIDAsha program you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a group of runners and volunteers

Please RSVP to this sessions Players can play longer if courts are available. Please bring a Can of new balls. There is public transportation via the D LIne on Sat. 

Heavy Rain cancels

Hope to see some of you there. 

Jeffrey Sussman
results.how_to_find_us: Newcomers should seek us out on the courts.  Super easy to find us.

results.description:
Run Details: Meet up with The Most Informal Running Club Ever at 10:00am for the weekly Saturday Fun Run. We'll split up into groups depending on the turnout for distance and time goals for 4, 6 or 7 mile loops. It's your choice!

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It's that easy.

Breakfast Details : Between 11:15 and 11:30 (depending on how long we run) we will meet back at Eastern Mountain Sports on Commonwealth Ave. near Packards Corner for Pot Luck style brunch.

Contribute to a great breakfast with an item to share with the group (eggs, bagels, fruits, muffins, juice, bacon, potatoes, etc.) You're not obligated to bring anything, though, so please join us for breakfast after the run anyway.

ALL ABILITY LEVELS WELCOME!!!

Secret parking is accessible in the Star Market parking lot (just make sure you walk through Star Market. No one has ever been towed.)

Bring a friend, see you out there.


informalrunning.com


Read the BLOG
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be eating breakfast.
results.name: The Saturday Big Group Run w/ Pot Luck B-Fast

Join us for a trail clearing hike around Mary Cummings Park.  Bring some clippers and work gloves and help clear some paths as we explore the trails of this park.  Help us beautify this hidden gem of a park just around the corner from the L.L.Bean Burlington retail store!

Ages 8 and up are welcome.  We recommend wearing long pants to protect from thorns, etc.

Any questions, please call the Burlington retail store at[masked]

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
